Information.Name: form
Information.Containers: htmlcontainer, dialog, container, tablecell, accordeon, dialog_2, vdomclass, smartfolderdata

Language.Sentence: The Form type produces an object that serves as a container for other form objects. Together they make up a form used for exchanging the data between the client and VDOM server. The form data can be sent by the 'POST', 'GET' or 'event' method selected in the 'Method' attribute, where the 'event' method means that the data will be sent as a parameter of the 'submit' event.
Order of rendering the object on the page. By default the value of hierarchy is 0, that means, that the object will be rendered in the order it is written in the XML-file of the VDOM application.

Position in visual hierarchy of objects. If you have several objects in one container situated on each other, the z-index indicates the order of their displaying. The larger z-index is, the upper the object lies.
Spacing between the top edge of the container and the object in pixels.
Spacing between the left edge of the container and the object in pixels.
Width of the object in pixels
Height of the object in pixels.
The top-level container where the form data are sent to on submit action. If no container is selected, the form data is to the same page (where the form is situated).

Tthe type of data encoding using the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME): none - defaults to an application/x-www-form-urlencoded; application/x-www-form-urlencoded - used if you do not know the type of data encoding; multipart/form-data - used if there is an Uploader object in the form, and some files will be sent by this form; text/plain - used if the plain text is sent by the form.

The request method, defines how the data will be sent: post - the encoded form data are sent separately, user does not see it; get - the encoded form data are sent in the URL string; event - the encoded form data are sent without reloading the page as the parameter of the event.

The overflow control mode: Auto - if the content fits in the object' borders - scrolling will not be shown; if not - the scrolling will be shown; Hidden - if the content does not fit in the object' borders - it will be cropped within the borders; Scroll - the horizontal and vertical scrolling will always be shown, no matter if the content fits or not; Visible - the whole content will always be shown without reference to the object's borders.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 99.
Incorrect value, must be either 0 or 1.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 9999.
Incorrect value, must be even positive integer.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 9999.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 999999.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 999999.
Incorrect value, must be valid URL.
Incorrect value, must be either 0 or 1.
Load data in HTML format to the server.
Resize the object width and height
Set URL where to send the data
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds.
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds
Hiérarchie de l'objet, ordre de chargement de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Niveau de superposition de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Distance depuis le bord haut de l'objet parent en pixels
Distance depuis le bord gauche de l'objet parent en pixels
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être une URL valide
Порядок визуализации объекта в ходе загрузки страницы
Расстояние от верхней границы родительского контейнера до объекта в пикселях
Расстояние от левой границы родительского контейнера до объекта в пикселях
Отправить форму только один раз до перезагрузки страницы
